sentence.Network_en: He hunted vainly through his pockets for a piece of paper.
sentence.Network_cn: 他翻遍口袋想找一张纸，结果没找到。

sentence.Network_en: The criminals vainly sought concealment from the searchlight.
sentence.Network_cn: 罪犯们徒劳地躲闪着探照灯光。

sentence.Network_en: He shouted after them, vainly trying to attract their attention.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在他们的后面高喊，想引起他们的注意，却是徒劳。

《红字》第九章_第2页_新沪江英语网... ... fascination 魔力,入迷,魅力 vainly 枉然的,无益地,徒然 creed 教条,主义,纲领.

list.abs: Then let the sad eyes of love vainly watch and weep ., 那就让爱情忧伤的双眼 , 突然地因盼望而流泪.
vainly是什么意思|vainly的中文意思... ... But Vainly ： 但没有用 Run vainly ： 白跑 It falls vainly ： 悄然滑落逝去.
Entered you to vainly hope for the world ., 进入了你梦想中的世界.
He had tried vainly and lost his heart at last ., 他徒劳地尝试 , 终于失去了信心.

entry.tran: 徒劳的;无效的;不成功的
entry.def: A vain attempt or action is one that fails to achieve what was intended.

example.ex: The drafting committee worked through the night in a vain attempt to finish on schedule...
example.tran: 起草委员会为按计划完成草案已通宵加班，但结果仍是徒劳。

example.ex: I was singing in a vain effort to cheer him up.
example.tran: 我唱歌试图让他高兴起来，结果是白费力气。

entry.def: If you describe a hope that something will happen as a vain hope, you mean that there is no chance of it happening.

example.ex: He married his fourth wife, Susan, in the vain hope that she would improve his health.
example.tran: 他娶了第四个老婆苏珊，徒然希望她能使他健康状况好转。

entry.tran: 自负的;虚荣的;自命不凡的
entry.def: If you describe someone as vain, you are critical of their extreme pride in their own beauty, intelligence, or other good qualities.

example.ex: I think he is shallow, vain and untrustworthy.
example.tran: 我认为他浅薄虚荣，不可信任。

entry.def: If you do something in vain, you do not succeed in achieving what you intend.

example.ex: He stopped at the door, waiting in vain for her to acknowledge his presence...
example.tran: 他在门口停住，徒然地等待她和自己打招呼。

example.ex: It became obvious that all her complaints were in vain.
example.tran: 很明显她所有的抱怨都是白费口舌。

entry.tran: 无用的;无意义的;无价值的
entry.def: If you say that something such as someone's  death, suffering, or effort was in vain, you mean that it was useless because it did not achieve anything.

example.ex: He wants the world to know his son did not die in vain.
example.tran: 他想让全世界都知道，他的儿子不是白白死去的。

sentences.sentence: "the city fathers tried vainly to find a solution"

auth_sentence.content: The convulsive sobs which the girl vainly tried to repress.
auth_sentence.res_content: The convulsive sobs which the girl vainly tried to repress.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The convulsive sobs which the girl vainly tried to repress.

auth_sentence.content: Charlotte vainly endeavoured to hide her confusion.
auth_sentence.res_content: Charlotte vainly endeavoured to hide her confusion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Charlotte vainly endeavoured to hide her confusion.

auth_sentence.content: Writers yelp vainly when directors muscle in on their screen credits.
auth_sentence.res_content: Writers yelp vainly when directors muscle in on their screen credits.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Writers yelp vainly when directors muscle in on their screen credits.

sentences.en: The team captain vainly tried to rally his troops.
sentences.cn: 队长试图振作部队的士气，但没有成功。

sentences.en: We tried vainly to discover what had happened.
sentences.cn: 我们设法想要弄清楚发生了什么事,但却徒劳。

sentences.en: The enemy vainly attempted destroying the bridge.
sentences.cn: 敌人妄图破坏这座桥梁。
